creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: woman sitting on bench holding a snake in PR hand very closely to her face, as if talking to it; elbow from arm with snake extends outside of image plane
inscription:
Signature, Stamp

-- in graphite on recto, bottom of sheet: [Marchande de Serpents]
markings: red stamp on recto, below right edge of image: Auguste Lepère, Lugt 141 (mark used for denoting proofs)
provenance: [C. & J. Goodfriend, New York; sold September 17, 1994, to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: signed in plate, far right: [A. Lepere]
title: Snake Merchant, from Fontainebleau Forest
